txt.en: Talk to Prince Ingór
Collect coal ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Add coal to the braziers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Vérnozal can be found in Máttugard, by the Steepset.\n\nPrince Ingór wishes to talk to you.
Vérnozal can be found in Máttugard, by the Steepset.\n\nYou should remove broken crates and other piles of debris from Vérnozal.
Hang Zhélruka banners ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'Bah! Look at this hall! I know we just moved in, but it is still a mess! How are we supposed to welcome travellers from near and far when Vérnozal is still filled with dust and debris? Visitors from nearby will take one look and return to where they came from, and visitors from far away will curse us for our lack of hospitality!\n\n'[placeholder], you must assist the Zhélruka and remove the broken crates and piles of debris from Vérnozal.'
You have pledged to lend your aid and your adventuring skills to the Zhélruka and to fight on their behalf in Gundabad.
Removed piles of debris ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Vérnozal can be found in Máttugard, by the Steepset.\n\nYou should collect coal in Vérnozal.

'Yes, this is quite a bit better! Now, what else is missing? Hmm....

'Ah, there is nothing in this hall that welcomes travellers and notifies them that this hall belongs to the mighty Zhélruka Clan!

'A banner or two should suffice! Take these Zhélruka Clan banners and hang them in Vérnozal.'
Vérnozal can be found in Máttugard, by the Steepset.\n\nYou should add coal to the braziers in Vérnozal.
Vérnozal can be found in Máttugard, by the Steepset.\n\nYou should hang Zhélruka banners in Vérnozal.
Chapter 2: The Mountain-home

'Good work! The hall is more welcoming already, and visitors will not be immediately consumed with disgust! That is an improvement. Now then, what else does Vérnozal need? Hmm....\n\n'It is a bit dim in here. Now that we would not be illuminating broken crates and dusty corners, we should brighten it up! Collect some coal in Vérnozal and add it to the braziers for me.'
Displayed Zhélruka banners ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Displayed a Longbeard banner

Added coal to braziers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'[placeholder], you must assist the Zhélruka and remove the broken crates and piles of debris from Vérnozal.'
Talk to Prince Ingór
'Thank you for assisting Ausma and Hórin with a mission. You have done much today. Still, more remains to be done. For now I will think on how we can make Vérnozal more inviting to all.'
Vérnozal can be found in Máttugard, by the Steepset.\n\nYou should hang a Longbeard banner in Vérnozal as well.
'Bah, look at this hall!'
You must assist the Zhélruka.'
'Good work.'
'Ah, you are right, it is a bit dim in here.'
Scout-master Ausma and Hórin can both be found at Vérnozal in Máttugard.\n\nYou should complete a Gundabad Mission with either Scout-master Ausma or Hórin.
'Ah, you are right, it is a bit dim in here.'
Vérnozal can be found in Máttugard, by the Steepset.\n\nPrince Ingór wishes to talk to you.
Now, what else is missing?'
'If Gundabad is to be our home, then the Zhélruka must be welcoming.'
'I believe that we have accomplished enough in making the hall of Vérnozal feel more welcoming.'
'Thank you.'
Vérnozal can be found in Máttugard, by the Steepset.\n\nPrince Ingór wishes to talk to you.
Vérnozal can be found in Máttugard, by the Steepset.\n\nPrince Ingór wishes to talk to you.
'Ah, you are right, it is a bit dim in here. We should brighten it up! Collect some coal in Vérnozal and add it to the braziers for me.'
Vérnozal can be found in Máttugard, by the Steepset.\n\nPrince Ingór wishes to talk to you.
'Ah, you are right, it is a bit dim in here. We should brighten it up! Collect some coal in Vérnozal and add it to the braziers for me.'

'Look how welcoming that one Longbeard banner makes the hall feel! Are you sure it helps?\n\n'I am very welcoming, with or without a banner, but if you think the banner is important, I will see that it stays. Now that we have made the hall of Vérnozal more inviting, perhaps you should put some of your other skills to use and assist Ausma and Hórin with a mission.'

'Ah yes, this hall proudly proclaims that it belongs to the Zhélruka now.

'What is that? You believe that raising Zhélruka banners may not be the most welcoming of sights for a newly-arrived traveller? The Zhélruka symbol is a symbol of honour!'

Prince Ingór takes a moment to regain his composure.

'Hmm, I suppose if Gundabad is to be our home, then the Zhélruka must acknowledge that it is to be a home for others as well. I do have one Longbeard banner here. Take it and hang it somewhere prominent. It will do for now.'
Removed broken crates ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Hang a Longbeard banner in the hall
